Class TravellingSalesman

  • java.lang.Object
    • TravellingSalesman

  • public class TravellingSalesman
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides a solution to the travelling salesman problem using Simulated Annealing
    Author:
    John Brockway

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TravellingSalesman() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static double annealingSchedule1(double t)
      Annealing Schedule 1: T decreases in a linear fashion by 1 each iteration
      static double annealingSchedule2(double t)
      Annealing Schedule 2: T decreases by a factor of .01% each iteration
      static double annealingSchedule3(int iteration)
      Annealing Schedule 3: T is equal to 100 (the original temperature) divided by the current iteration number
      static double getEuclideanDistance(City a, City b)
      Gets the Euclidean distance between two points on a 2D plane represented by City objects
      static double getPathCost(java.util.ArrayList<City> path)
      Gets the total cost for a path, represented by a State object
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      The main function which converts the input into a form usable by the search method
      static State simulatedAnnealing(City[] cities, int schedule)
      The implementation of Simulated Annealing

    • Constructor Detail

      • TravellingSalesman

        public TravellingSalesman()

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        The main function which converts the input into a form usable by the search method
        Parameters:
        args - Contains the file of the problem instance in a specified form of "#-of-cities\nName x-Coordinate yCoordinate\nName x-Coordinate yCoordinate etc.". The second argument is the annealing schedule to use, from 1-3.

      • simulatedAnnealing

        public static State simulatedAnnealing(City[] cities,
                                       int schedule)
        The implementation of Simulated Annealing
        Parameters:
        cities - A list of City that represents every single city in the problem
        schedule - The annealing schedule to use
        Returns:
        A complete State, with all nodes included in the path (not necessarily optimal, an estimation based on annealing schedule used)

      • getEuclideanDistance

        public static double getEuclideanDistance(City a,
                                          City b)
        Gets the Euclidean distance between two points on a 2D plane represented by City objects
        Parameters:
        a - A City
        b - A City
        Returns:
        The Euclidean distance between a and b

      • getPathCost

        public static double getPathCost(java.util.ArrayList<City> path)
        Gets the total cost for a path, represented by a State object
        Parameters:
        path - The current state of the path
        Returns:
        The total cost of the path contained in state

      • annealingSchedule1

        public static double annealingSchedule1(double t)
        Annealing Schedule 1: T decreases in a linear fashion by 1 each iteration
        Parameters:
        t - The current temperature
        Returns:
        The temperature for the next iteration

      • annealingSchedule2

        public static double annealingSchedule2(double t)
        Annealing Schedule 2: T decreases by a factor of .01% each iteration
        Parameters:
        t - The current temperature
        Returns:
        The temperature for the next iteration

      • annealingSchedule3

        public static double annealingSchedule3(int iteration)
        Annealing Schedule 3: T is equal to 100 (the original temperature) divided by the current iteration number
        Parameters:
        iteration - The current iteration that has just completed
        Returns:
        The temperature for the next iteration
